SINT_Execution_Output.Summary: FD synthesized and SINT prompt generated under Debates (N=4). Proceeded via Scenario 3B (Consensus) for the meta-synthesis to ensure clarity and coverage of requirements. Four downstream tasks were produced for Cases 2â€“5 with specified methodologies.

Task.title: AI Safety Policy Trade-offs in Autonomous Urban Delivery
Task.objective: Create a multi-agent debate that evaluates safety, efficiency, and ethical trade-offs in deploying autonomous delivery robots in dense urban environments. Require detailed positions, numerical ratings (1-10), cross-criticism, and iterative convergence under a conflict scenario.
Task.context: City logistics constraints, pedestrian safety norms, local regulations, and operational KPIs. Include concrete examples (e.g., night-time deliveries, school zones).
Task.methodology: Debates (N=3) with Step 3A (Conflict) for at least 2 rounds, using Divergence Ratings and compromise proposals.
Task.experts: - Urban Safety Regulator - Operations Optimization Engineer - Ethics and Public Trust Specialist
Task.constraints: PCG required; ratings and cross-evaluation mandatory each round; Dual Output with Verification Report.
Task.expected_outcomes: Clear compromise principles for deployment policies, risk mitigations, and KPIs with thresholds.

Task.title: Open-Source Sustainability Strategy for a Core ML Library
Task.objective: Design a debate to integrate contributor growth, long-term funding, and stability guarantees into a cohesive sustainability roadmap for an open-source ML core library.
Task.context: Release cadence, backward compatibility, governance models, and sponsor expectations. Use real examples of policy options (LTS branches, RFC processes).
Task.methodology: Debates (N=3) with Step 3B (Consensus). No criticism; focus on integration and prioritization.
Task.experts: - Project Governance Lead - Ecosystem Developer Advocate - Financial Sustainability Advisor
Task.constraints: PCG required; ratings (1-10) and cross-evaluation at Step 2; Dual Output with Verification Report.
Task.expected_outcomes: Prioritized policy set with measurable targets (e.g., SLA for PR review, release SLOs, funding tiers).

Task.title: Model Evaluation Protocol under Data Drift
Task.objective: Create a Generator+Critic workflow to build a robust evaluation protocol for ML systems facing covariate shift and data drift across quarters.
Task.context: Monitoring signals, acceptance thresholds, retraining triggers, A/B guardrails; references to drift detection literature.
Task.methodology: Generator + External Critic (N=2) with explicit feedback loops and mandatory corrections.
Task.experts: - Evaluation Protocol Architect (Generator) - Risk and Compliance Reviewer (Critic)
Task.constraints: PCG required; numeric ratings (1-10) for risk/coverage; Dual Output with Verification Report.
Task.expected_outcomes: Stepwise protocol with metrics, thresholds, rollback criteria, and escalation paths.

Task.title: National Grid Resilience under Extreme Weather
Task.objective: Conduct a multi-agent conflict-oriented debate to derive investment and operational strategies that maximize grid resilience during compound extreme weather events.
Task.context: Generation mix, transmission constraints, demand response, distributed storage, maintenance scheduling. Use concrete stress scenarios.
Task.methodology: Debates (N=4) with Step 3A (Conflict). At least 2 rounds with divergence ratings and compromise synthesis.
Task.experts: - Transmission Systems Engineer - Renewable Integration Strategist - Reliability and Maintenance Planner - Energy Policy and Regulation Analyst
Task.constraints: PCG required; detailed ratings and cross-evaluation; Dual Output with Verification Report.
Task.expected_outcomes: Ranked portfolio of actions with cost/benefit/risk, and triggers for operational modes.
